Package tuition

Class Roster

java.lang.Object
tuition.Roster
public class Roster extends Object
Roster is a collection of Students. Roster defines an array list data structure to hold the Students and provides operations to manage the collection.
Author:
Sarah McNey, Cynthia Zhu

  • Constructor Details

    • Roster

      public Roster()
      Constructor that creates a Student array list of capacity 4 and size 0.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find(Student student)
      Searches for the argument student in the array list using linear search.
      Parameters:
      student - The student to be searched for
      Returns:
      The index of the student if found, -1 if not found

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Increases the capacity of the array list by 4.

    • add

      public boolean add(Student student)
      Inserts the argument student at the end of the array list. If capacity is reached, calls the grow() method to increase the capacity by 4.
      Parameters:
      student - The student to be inserted
      Returns:
      True if the student was inserted, false if the student was found

    • remove

      public boolean remove(Student student)
      Deletes the argument student from the array list. Maintains the order of the array list.
      Parameters:
      student - The student to be deleted
      Returns:
      True if the student was deleted, false if the student was not found

    • hasStudent

      public boolean hasStudent(Student student)
      Determines whether the array list contains the argument student.
      Parameters:
      student - Student
      Returns:
      True if the array list contains the argument student, false if not

    • isResident

      public boolean isResident(Student student)
      Determines whether the argument student is a resident student.
      Parameters:
      student - Student
      Returns:
      True if the argument student is a resident student, false if not

    • isFullTime

      public boolean isFullTime(Student student)
      Determines whether the argument student is a full-time student.
      Parameters:
      student - Student
      Returns:
      True if the argument student is a full-time student, false if not

    • getBalance

      public double getBalance(Student student)
      Gets the balance of the argument student.
      Parameters:
      student - Student
      Returns:
      The balance of the argument student

    • getFinancialAidStatus

      public boolean getFinancialAidStatus(Student student)
      Gets the financial aid status of the argument student.
      Parameters:
      student - Student
      Returns:
      The financial aid status of the argument student

    • makePayment

      public boolean makePayment(Student student)
      Makes a payment for the argument student.
      Parameters:
      student - The student who is making a payment
      Returns:
      True if the payment is made, false if the student is not found

    • calculateBalance

      public void calculateBalance()
      Calculates balance for all students in array list.

    • applyFinancialAid

      public boolean applyFinancialAid(Student student)
      Applies financial aid for the argument student.
      Parameters:
      student - The student who is receiving financial aid
      Returns:
      True if financial aid is applied, false if the student is not found

    • enrollInStudyAbroad

      public boolean enrollInStudyAbroad(Student student)
      Enrolls argument student in study abroad program.
      Parameters:
      student - The student to be enrolled in the study abroad program
      Returns:
      True if the student is enrolled in the study abroad program, false if the student is not found

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the array list.

    • printByName

      public void printByName()
      Sorts the array list by name using selection sort and prints the array list.

    • printByPaymentDate

      public void printByPaymentDate()
      Prints only the students who have made payments sorted by payment date.
